items.name: Vert.x Web
items.description: Vert.x-Web is a tool-kit for writing sophisticated modern web applications and HTTP microservices.

items.name: Vert.x Web Client
items.description: Vert.x Web Client is an easy to use advanced HTTP client.

items.name: Web GraphQL Handler
items.description: Create GraphQL servers with Vert.x Web and the GraphQL-Java library.

items.name: Web API Contract
items.description: Web API Contract supports OpenApi 3 specification for a design first approach and provides a validation framework.

stack.description: Vert.x provides a few different asynchronous clients for accessing various data stores from your application. You don't have to use these clients - you could use clients direct from the vendor if you prefer (e.g. MongoDB provide their own cool async and reactive clients), but these provide a simple async API which is available in various languages.
Vert.x provides a few components to make your applications more reactive.

items.name: Vert.x RxJava v1
items.description: Don't like callback-style APIs? Vert.x provides Rx-ified (using RxJava) versions for most of its APIs so you can use those if you prefer. RxJava is a great choice when you want to perform complex operations on multiple asynchronous streams of data.

items.name: Vert.x RxJava v2
items.description: Don't like callback-style APIs? Vert.x provides Rx-ified (using RxJava) versions for most of its APIs so you can use those if you prefer. RxJava is a great choice when you want to perform complex operations on multiple asynchronous streams of data.

items.name: Reactive streams
items.description: Vert.x supports reactive streams so your applications can interoperate with other reactive systems such as Akka or Project Reactor.

items.name: Vert.x Sync
items.description: Vertx-sync allows you to deploy verticles that run using fibers. Fibers are very lightweight threads that can be blocked without blocking a kernel thread. This enables you to write your verticle code in a familiar synchronous style.

items.name: Vert.x Kotlin coroutines
items.description: Kotlin coroutines for Vert.x, gives you super powers such as async/await or Go-like channels. This enables you to write your verticle code in a familiar sequential style.

stack.description: Vert.x offers various component to build microservice-based applications.

items.name: Vert.x Service Discovery
items.description: This component lets you publish, lookup and bind to any type of services.

items.name: Vert.x Circuit Breaker
items.description: This component provides an implementation of the circuit breaker pattern for Vert.x

items.name: Vert.x Config
items.description: This component provides an extensible way to configure Vert.x applications.

items.name: MQTT
items.description: Vert.x MQTT (client and server) is able to handle connections, communication and messages exchange with remote MQTT clients. Its API provides a bunch of events related to protocol messages received by clients and exposes allow to send messages to them.

stack.description: Vert.x provides simple APIs for auth in your applications. We also provide a few out of the box implementations.

items.name: JDBC auth
items.description: Auth implementation backed by JDBC

items.name: JWT auth
items.description: Auth implementation using JSON web tokens (JWT)

items.name: Shiro auth
items.description: Auth implementation using Apache Shiro

items.name: MongoDB auth
items.description: Auth implementation using MongoDB

items.name: OAuth 2
items.description: Auth implementation for OAuth2

items.name: .htdigest Auth
items.description: .htdigest file to query user information

items.name: AMQP Client
items.description: A client for interacting with an AMQP 1.0 broker or router.

items.name: STOMP Client and Server
items.description: Vert.x provides an implementation of the STOMP protocol.

items.name: RabbitMQ Client
items.description: A client to interact with RabbitMQ.

items.name: AMQP Bridge
items.description: A bridge for interacting with an AMQP 1.0 broker or router.

items.name: Mail Client
items.description: Vert.x provides a simple SMTP mail client so you can send emails from your applications.

items.name: JCA Adaptor
items.description: Vert.x provides a Java Connector Architecture (JCA) adaptor which allows it to interoperate with any JavaEE application server.

items.name: Kafka Client
items.description: A client to interact with Apache Kafka.

items.name: Consul Client
items.description: A client to interact with Consul.

stack.description: Vert.x offers various bridges to extend the Event Bus beyond the JVM

items.name: TCP Eventbus Bridge
items.description: An eventbus bridge that lets you interact with Vert.x from any application thanks to a TCP socket.

items.name: Camel Bridge
items.description: An eventbus bridge that lets you interact with Apache Camel endpoints and routes

stack.description: Vert.x offers various component to keep your Vert.x application on track when running in production

items.name: Metrics using Dropwizard
items.description: This component captures metrics from Vert.x core components and exposes them using Dropwizard.

items.name: Metrics using Micrometer
items.description: This component captures metrics from Vert.x core components and exposes them using Micrometer.

items.name: Vert.x Health Check
items.description: This component provides a simple way to expose health checks.

items.name: Shell
items.description: This component lets you interact with your Vert.x application using a CLI interface.

stack.description: Vert.x-Unit is an unit testing tool-kit especially design to work well with asynchronous code.
Vert.x supports clustering and HA out of the box. Cluster group management is implemented in cluster managers which are pluggable. The default cluster manager uses Hazelcast.

items.name: Hazelcast
items.description: Cluster manager implementation that uses Hazelcast. This is the default.

items.name: Infinispan
items.description: Cluster manager implementation that uses Infinispan.

items.name: Apache Ignite
items.description: Cluster manager implementation that uses Apache Ignite.

items.name: Apache Zookeper
items.description: Cluster manager implementation that uses Apache Zookeeper.

stack.description: Vert.x services are a simple and effective way to encapsulate reusable functionality for use elsewhere. Services are deployed using a service identifier which decouples the user from details of the implementation.

items.name: Service Proxies
items.description: Proxies allow remote event bus services to be called as if they were local.

items.name: SockJS Service Proxies
items.description: Allow event bus services to be called from JavaScript (browser or Node.js).

items.name: gRPC
items.description: Implement gRPC Clients and Servers for Vert.x.

items.name: Service Factories
items.description: How to package and deploy Vert.x independent services.

items.name: Maven Service Factory
items.description: This lets you dynamically install and deploy services from Maven at run-time.

items.name: HTTP Service Factory
items.description: This lets you dynamically install and deploy services from an HTTP server (for example Bintray at run-time.
